Description: Eleven reconstructed fragments of the upper part of a black-figure painted pottery situla. A, owl, galloping horse, in field incised rosettes; B, two lions back-to-back, turning to look at one another: below, parts of palmettes, lotus flowers, and a single lotus petal. Much of the paint has vanished, but there are traces of purple on tail-feathers and head of owl, for bridle of horse, on alternate petals of rosettes, and on tongue, mane, and belly of lions.
Bibliographic references: Vase / Catalogue of Vases in the British Museum (B106.4)
CVA British Museum 8 / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum: Great Britain 13, British Museum 8 (Pl. GB 602, 5-6 (and Pl. GB 597, 5-6)) (Group C11)
Petrie 1888 / Tanis. Part II. Nebesheh (Am) and Defenneh (Tahpanhes) (pl. xxvi, 5)
Weber 2012 / Untersuchungen zur archaischen griechischen Keramik aus anderen ägyptischen Fundorten (TD 251)
